details.description: The Rural Development Programme for England: Farming and Forestry Improvement Scheme, Rural Community Broadband Fund, Rural Economy Grant, Skills and Knowledge Transfer
details.body:
If you are a farmer, grower, forester, land owner, rural business or part of a rural community you could potentially benefit from funding provided through the Rural Development Programme for England (RDPE).

There are various forms of support offered by RDPE, including:

  • Farming and Forestry Improvement Scheme
  • Rural Community Broadband Fund
  • Rural Economy Grant
  • Skills and Knowledge Transfer

You may also be able to get funding and support at a local level through the network of Local Action Groups (LAGs) in England. These are made up of interested volunteers from the public, private and voluntary sectors.
details.short_description: Advice and funding for delegates who work in rural communities.
details.eligibility: Farmers, growers, foresters, land owners, rural businesses and others in England. See the RDPE Network website for details.
details.additional_information: As well as providing information about grants and support, the RDPE Network website helps you to share ideas, knowledge and experience with others. It has a project directory containing information on projects across the English regions, discussion forums and details of upcoming events you can attend.
